Division St. Handbill issued by the Society "Znanie" in April 1929FOR THE FIRST TIME IN CHICAGO THE RUSSIAN SOCIETY "ZNANIE" STAGES A MOCK TRIAL ON SUNDAY, APRIL 21, 1929, AT THE LIBERTY SONS' HALL, 1042 NORTH ROBEY STREET(Damen Ave.)

body.p: In 3 acts -- Stage Manager and Author --Mr. V. I. Baycher ...

row.cell: The Boarder's attorney for the defense
The Wife's attorney for the defense

body.p: ACT I -- THE TRIAL: Cross examination of the witnesses, depositions of the defendants and the prosecutors. Speeches of the prosecuting attorney and of the attorneys for the defense.
ACT III- (2 years later): The jail, the dissolution of the Byelov family, Byelov's death.
Children under the age of 16 are not admitted.

Tickets can be bought beforehand at the society Znanie, 1902 W. Division street, at the office of the newspaper Rassviet, 1722 W. Chicago Avenue, at the "Boston" Restaurant, 1952 W. Division street, at the Humboldt Barber Shop, 1152 N. California avenue, at N. Kotov's barber shop, 2734
W. 18th street, and from all members of the Society Znanie.
Charge for tickets: if bought beforehand, 50 cents; if bought at the entrance to the hall, 65 cents. (The charge for the first one hundred seats is $1). The curtain is raised at 5 P. M.
